newsitem.title: PERU: Peru to honor Japan's disgraced former envoy Aoki.
newsitem.headline: Peru to honor Japan's disgraced former envoy Aoki.

text.p: Peru said on Thursday it would decorate former Japanese ambassador Morihisa Aoki with its highest national honour -- the Order of the Sun -- despite his fall from grace in his homeland.
"This is a show of support from the Peruvian government for the work of Morihisa Aoki," President Alberto Fujimori said.
The award recognised both Aoki's work in strengthening Peru-Japan relations, and his "courage and dexterity" during the four-month hostage crisis at his former home in Lima, Fujimori added.

Initially hailed in Japan as a hero who stoutly defended fellow hostages during the 126-day siege by Marxist rebels, Aoki drew criticism on his return home when attention switched from the captives' fate to how the incident happened.
He was fired from his post last week, but remains in Japan's Foreign Ministry.
Fujimori said Peru's ambassador to Japan, Victor Aritomi, would present the award to Aoki later Thursday in Tokyo.
Aritomi's brother Pedro Aritomi was among the 72 hostages held by Marxist guerrillas from the Tupac Amaru Revolutionary Movement (MRTA) at the diplomatic compound.
Peruvian troops released all but one of the hostages in an April 22 strike that killed the 14 MRTA rebels, and also left two soldiers and a captive judge dead.
